dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...treat Hong Kong like, uh, mainland China, right? No more special privileges, no special economic status.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...treat Hong Kong like, uh, mainland China, right? No more special privileges, no special economic status.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hong Kong will now be treated the same as mainland China, no special privileges, no special economic treatment and no export of sensitive technologies, Trump said on Tuesday during a press conference in the White House Rose Garden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, "no more special privileges." Like that's, what, new news? Trump just said it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, no more special privileges. Like that's, what, new news? Trump just said it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hong Kong will now be treated the same as mainland China, no special privileges, no special economic treatment and no export of sensitive technologies, Trump said on Tuesday during a press conference in the White House Rose Garden.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he, um, also said their freedom, like, has been taken away. And with it, goes Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he, um, also said their freedom, like, has been taken away. And with it, goes Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Their freedom has been taken away. Their rights have been taken away. And with it, goes Hong Kong, in my opinion, because it will no longer be able to compete with free markets, Trump added.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Right, "in his opinion." Because his opinions are, you know, always so grounded in reality. But he, uh, also predicted a complete economic collapse for them. Within a year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, in his opinion. Because his opinions are, you know, always so grounded in reality. But he, uh, also predicted a complete economic collapse for them. Within a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: A year? So, just, poof, gone? You really buy that timeline?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A year? So, just, poof, gone? You really buy that timeline?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, China's certainly, like, condemning the Autonomy Act. Threatening sanctions against us.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, China's certainly, like, condemning the Autonomy Act. Threatening sanctions against us.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Chinas Foreign Ministry said that it firmly opposes and strongly condemns the signing of the Hong Kong Autonomy Act into law. China will make necessary responses to protect its legitimate interests, and impose sanctions on relevant personnel and entities of the United States, the ministry said in a statement released on its website.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, now China's condemning it? After they, uh, imposed their own security law, punishing everything?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, now China's condemning it? After they, uh, imposed their own security law, punishing everything?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The national security law that China imposed on Hong Kong has been heavily criticized for eliminating many of the freedoms promised to the city when it returned to Chinese rule in 1997.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's about, like, the extradition treaty being ended, and sensitive tech exports.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's about, like, the extradition treaty being ended, and sensitive tech exports.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Specifically, Washington will end its extradition treaty with Hong Kong, impose limits on exports of sensitive technology to the city and treat Hong Kong passport holders the same as those possessing Chinese passports.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Sensitive tech? What, like, fancy iPhones? Or something that actually, you know, matters?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sensitive tech? What, like, fancy iPhones? Or something that actually, you know, matters?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: And the Autonomy Act itself, it, uh, targets officials who've infringed on rights.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Autonomy Act itself, it, uh, targets officials who've infringed on rights.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Hong Kong Autonomy Act requires the government to identify mainland Chinese or Hong Kong officials who have contravened the rights and freedoms promised to Hong Kong before 1997, and then impose sanctions on those individuals and any banks that do business with them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Right, identifying them. That'll totally, you know, solve everything. A list. Brilliant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, identifying them. That'll totally, you know, solve everything. A list. Brilliant.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It's meant to, like, impose sanctions on them and banks that do business.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's meant to, like, impose sanctions on them and banks that do business.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Hong Kong Autonomy Act requires the government to identify mainland Chinese or Hong Kong officials who have contravened the rights and freedoms promised to Hong Kong before 1997, and then impose sanctions on those individuals and any banks that do business with them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Sure. Because those banks will just, you know, stop doing business with the world's second-largest economy. But the national security law, that's, like, huge. Eliminating freedoms, up to life in prison.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sure. Because those banks will just, you know, stop doing business with the world's second-largest economy. But the national security law, that's, like, huge. Eliminating freedoms, up to life in prison.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The national security law that China imposed on Hong Kong has been heavily criticized for eliminating many of the freedoms promised to the city when it returned to Chinese rule in 1997. It punishes what Beijing broadly defines as subversion, secession, terrorism and collusion with foreign agencies with up to life in prison.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: And we're just, what, reacting to that now? After the fact? Seems a bit late, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And we're just, what, reacting to that now? After the fact? Seems a bit late, doesn't it?
